author: detroitnews.com
title: Lions cut DT Ishmaa’ily Kitchen
text:
Ishmaa'ily Kitchen (Photo: Tony Dejak, Associated Press) 
CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Allen Park — Ishmaa’ily Kitchen’s time with the Lions lasted just two weeks.
The team announced Friday that it cut the 27-year-old defensive tackle, whose lone game for the Lions was last Sunday against the Bears.
With Haloti Ngata likely returning for Sunday’s game against the Vikings (1 p.m., FOX), Kitchen no longer had a role on the defense. Ngata missed the past two games, but he’ll return to being a starter next to Caraun Reid with Andre Fluellen, Jermelle Cudjo and Gabe Wright as backups.
Kitchen was inactive his first game with the Lions after signing on Oct. 8. He played 15 snaps last Sunday, but did not accumulate any statistics.
Without Kitchen, the Lions are down to 89 players on the active roster. They could promote a practice squad player Saturday if they need depth at a certain spot for Sunday's game.
jkatzenstein@detroitnews.com
